title: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announces mandatory evacuation from Donetsk region
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday called on the remaining residents of the Donetsk region to urgently evacuate in what he called a "government decision."

title: Shakira to go to trial in Spain for alleged tax fraud
description: Shakira has failed to reach an agreement with Spanish prosecutors on tax evasion charges, and she will go to trial insisting on her innocence, according to a statement released by her public relations team.

title: 'Appalling' videos alleged to show Russian soldiers castrating a Ukrainian soldier
description: Videos alleged to show Russian soldiers castrating and killing a bound and gagged Ukrainian soldier are circulating on social media, drawing an accusation of potential war crimes from the United Nations and prompting a Ukrainian investigation into possible torture.

title: A 17-year-old swam out of her flooded home with her dog and waited for hours on a roof to be rescued
description: Early Thursday morning, 17-year-old Chloe Adams woke up to a nightmare. Rushing waters were coming out of the bathroom drains, bubbling up through the kitchen tiles and quickly surrounding her home.

title: President Joe Biden tests positive for Covid-19 again
description: President Joe Biden has tested positive again for Covid-19, the White House said Saturday.

title: One ticket in Illinois won the second-largest Mega Millions jackpot of nearly $1.34 billion
description: One ticket in Illinois claimed the second-largest Mega Millions jackpot of an estimated $1.28 billion during Friday night's drawing, according to the Illinois Lottery.

title: Death toll from Kentucky flooding 'could potentially double' as people in stricken areas remain hard to reach, governor says
description: After days of fatal flooding washed away parts of eastern Kentucky and claimed the lives of at least 16 people, first responders will continue working Saturday to account for missing residents, the state's governor said.

title: Women's Euro 2022: England out to avenge 2009 final defeat in rematch against Germany
description: England against Germany, a clash between two of the best national teams in the world, will be a fitting finale to what has been a record-breaking tournament at Euro 2022.

title: More than 100 injured in Baghdad clashes as demonstrators storm Iraq's parliament
description: Dozens of people have been injured in Baghdad on Saturday after protesters rallying against the nomination of a new prime minister managed to breach the Iraqi capital's heavily fortified Green Zone for the second time this week.

title: Why you should reach out to old friends
description: Thinking of reaching out to old friends but nervous it will be awkward or that they won't appreciate it? You should make those phone calls or send a text or email, according to new research.

title: A huge humpback whale breached and hit a boat in Massachusetts
description: Boaters in Massachusetts had a once-in-a-lifetime encounter with a real-life whale tail.

title: $2.1 million in liquid meth seized at Texas border crossing
description: Officials found more than $2 million in methamphetamine hidden in a vehicle at the Rio Grande City Port of Entry in Texas, US Customs and Border Protection say.

title: 'Paper Girls' delivers with time travel, '80s girl power and Ali Wong
description: There is just something about summertime that makes me feel nostalgic.

title: The 'progress recession' has been here for decades
description: One of the sillier arguments you'll read about in the coming weeks and months is over whether the US has technically entered a recession.

title: The strange reason America's economy is shrinking
Russia's Gazprom says it has stopped gas supplies to Latvia
description: Russian state-owned energy company Gazprom said on Saturday it had stopped supplying gas to Latvia, accusing the Baltic country of "violating conditions for gas withdrawal," without giving any further details.

title: Will Smith addresses Oscars slap in new video
description: Will Smith is "deeply remorseful" about slapping Chris Rock at the Academy Awards in March.

title: Watch Will Smith's apology to Chris Rock
description: Actor Will Smith apologized to Chris Rock months after Smith hit Rock at the Academy Awards.

title: 12 Black queer icons that inspired Beyoncé on 'Renaissance'
description: Beyoncé's newest album, "Renaissance," is a musical triumph that signals the next great phase of the superstar's career -- and she's taking the Black queer icons who pioneered house music with her.

title: These are the next states that could call special sessions to limit abortion rights
description: The overturning of Roe v. Wade gives the green light to Republican-led states to pass stricter abortion laws, and several legislatures, rather than wait for the traditional legislative season to begin in the fall, are calling extraordinary sessions this summer to immediately take action.

title: Travel news: Close encounters with sharks, monk seals and jellyfish
description: In travel news this week, Spain is offering free train journeys, Southwest Airlines is making its vouchers valid forever, and we take a look at the world's greatest hiking trails and Iceland's best bathing spots.

title: China to hold live-fire exercises in waters near Fujian, opposite Taiwan
description: China is planning to conduct live-fire exercises on Saturday in waters near Pingtan Island of Fujian province, which is opposite the self-governing island of Taiwan.

title: These are the gun control laws passed in 2022 so far
description: Several mass shootings and a sustained rise in gun violence across the United States have spurred law enforcement officials and lawmakers to push for more gun control measures.

title: This doctor reversed heart disease. Now he wants to do it for Alzheimer's
description: In 1990, internal medicine specialist Dr. Dean Ornish did what no other doctor had been able to do: He published results of a randomized clinical trial that used advanced imagery scans to show coronary artery disease could be reversed with nothing more than diet, exercise, stress reduction and social support.

title: Giant screen hits dancers for boy band Mirror during Hong Kong concert
description: A back-up dancer for the Cantopop boy band Mirror is in intensive care after being hit by a giant video panel that fell from the ceiling during a concert in Hong Kong.

title: Russia offers big money to recruit for Ukraine war
description: Across Russia, volunteer battalions are being formed to deploy to the war in Ukraine, joining the so-called "special military operation" declared by President Vladimir Putin in February.

title: Spain reports first monkeypox-related death in Europe
description: Spain reported its first monkeypox-related death on Friday, in what is thought to be Europe's first fatality from the disease and only the second outside Africa in the current outbreak.

title: What does Taiwan think about the possibility of a visit by Nancy Pelosi?
description: Reports that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is planning a visit to Taiwan have sparked tense exchanges between the United States and China -- and growing speculation over how Beijing might react.

title: Dramatic footage shows police in shootout with suspected gang members
description: For months, Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince has been trapped in a brutal cycle of gang violence. The mayor of a besieged neighborhood in the Haitian capital said hundreds of people have been killed in July alone due to ongoing gang-related violence. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: Russian officials requested adding convicted murderer to US prisoner swap
description: Russian government officials requested that a former colonel from the country's domestic spy agency who was convicted of murder in Germany last year be included in the US' proposed swap of a notorious arms dealer Viktor Bout for Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan, multiple sources familiar with the discussions told CNN.
